intro: Lithocarpus laoticus var. laoticus, commonly known as the Laotian stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, characterized by its hard, woody fruits and evergreen foliage. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the mountainous regions of Laos and Vietnam. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy upper surface with a pale underside. The fruit is a坚果 (nut-like) structure, which is typically enclosed in a woody cupule, a feature common among the genus Lithocarpus.
